title: JavabyteKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about JavabyteKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
byte myNum = 100;
System.out.println(myNum);

Definition and Usage
The
byte
keyword is a data type that can store whole numbers from -128 to 127.
Related Pages
Read more about data types in our
Java Data Types Tutorial
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers JavabyteKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavabyteKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of JavabyteKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
